channel.title: If Statements Explained

item.title: If Statements Explained
item.dc:creator: @carney carney
item.description:
@carney wrote:

If Statement Explained!

ok to start i will show you an if statement and explain it in better detail

if(playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("Carn Carn") && playerRights >= 1) { teleportToX = 241; teleportToY = 241; else if(playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("D E C O Y") && isNoob() == true) { CanhaveChildren == False; } }

ok now to explain ^.^

the first line if(playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“carney”) && playerRights >= 1) this is pretty self explanitory. If the playername equals Carn Carn and the player rights are biggerthan or equal to 1 then do everything within ‘{’ and ‘}’ but if it doesnt it skips everything within ‘{’ and '}'unless there is an else if…

the next two lines teleport the player to the desired location…

this line: else if(playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“D E C O Y”) && isNoob() == true) is what it will read if the playername isnt carn carn and the rights aren’t >= 1 and again, if it doesn’t then it skips

here is an easy way of putting this if statement that might let you understand easyer

If (playername = "CarN CarN") And (playerrights >= 1) Then Me.teleportToX = 241 me.teleportToY = 241 ElseIf (playername = "D E C O Y") And (isNoob) Then Me.CanhaveChildren = False End If

the ‘then’ is the ‘{’ and the End if is the ‘}’ i hope this is easy to understand, and helps you

TO THE MODS: if you find this doesn’t help then please, lock it i dont want anything that will confuse this learning environment

Read full topic
